channel.title: Dragon Claws

item.title: Dragon Claws
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Dcrew Mod Dcrew
item.description:
@Mod_Dcrew wrote:

Hello!

I have 2 clients (mine and another persons)

And the other has full d-claw emote, The emote is 6000 in the server, Which I would like to add… I searched through a FileSearcher and found this in class 8:

if(i == 8002) { class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wield"; class8.anInt174 = 13698; class8.anInt181 = 738; // zoom; increase will make it smaller class8.anInt190 = 245; // model rotate; up+down increase to move down away from you class8.anInt198 = 80; // model rotate; side ways increase to move right in circle class8.anInt169 = -2; // model offset; increase to move to the right class8.anInt194 = 3; // model offset; increase to move up class8.anInt165 = 13699; class8.anInt200 = 13699; class8.anInt188 = -1; class8.anInt164 = -1; class8.aString170 = "Dragon claws"; class8.aByteArray178 = "A pair of claws, once enchanted by the gods.".getBytes(); }

And this in class 20:

if(j == 6000) { //Saradomin Sword int file = 1919; if(FrameStart[file] < 1) Class36.methodCustomAnimations(false, file); int[] frames = { 75, 75, 62, 62, 93, 93, 93, 82, 82, 57, 57, 71, 71, 66, 66, 66, 61, 92, 73, 73, 65, 65, 89, 89, 70, 70, 81, 81, 67, 67, 67, 84, 59, 63, 63, 99, 99, 78, 69, 69, 96, 96, 74, 74, 74, 79, 90, 90, 94, 94, 58, 0 }; aClass20Array351[j].anInt352 = frames.length-1; aClass20Array351[j].anIntArray353 = new int[frames.length-1]; aClass20Array351[j].anIntArray354 = new int[frames.length-1]; aClass20Array351[j].anIntArray355 = new int[frames.length-1]; for(int i2 = 0; i2 < frames.length-1; i2++) { aClass20Array351[j].anIntArray353[i2] = frames[i2]+FrameStart[file]; aClass20Array351[j].anIntArray354[i2] = -1; aClass20Array351[j].anIntArray355[i2] = 0; } }

But you see I have never done emote adding so I am not sure how to transfer 1 client emote to another… I would just use that client but for some reason it’s disliking my server and is not compatiable with it.

Thanks, Help appreciated!
